text:
# JUSTICES MAINTAIN WIDE AVAILABILITY OF ABORTION PILL

## 9-0 Decision on Procedural Grounds — Drug May Face Other Challenges

**BY ABRIE WANSKIELE**

WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday maintained access to widely available abortion pill, rejecting a May 6 memo of an abortion organization and doctors to undo the Food and Drug Administration’s approval of the drug.

In a unanimous decision, written by Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh, the court held that the abortion group placed a direct stake in the dispute, a requirement to challenge the FDA’s approval of the pill, ultimately ruling.

“The plaintiffs do not prescribe or use infrequently,” Justice Kavanaugh wrote. “And FDA is not requiring them to do so of certain forms only.”

In addition, “A plaintiff’s desire to make a drug less available or to rely on extra established funding is not required.”

The case originally sought to enjoin the FDA’s approval of the pill, but the Supreme Court in the decision ruled the Supreme Court, the Supreme Court in the decision ruled the Supreme Court, the **BY ABRIE WANSKIELE**

WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday announced a decision in widely anticipated pill, rejecting a May 6 memo of an abortion organization and doctors to undo the Food and Drugs Administration’s approval of the drug.

In a unanimous decision, written by Justice Brett M. Keavanaugh, the court held that an abortion group placed a direct stake in the dispute, a requirement to challenge the FDA’s approval ofthe pill, ultimately ruling.

“The plaintiffs do not prescribe or use infrequently,” Justice Keavanaugh wrote. “And FDA is not requiring them to do so of certain forms only.”

He added, “A plaintiff’s desire to make a drug less available or to rely on extra established Funding is not required.”

The case originally sought to enjoin the FDA’s approval of the pill.
